Herbal Remedies: One creative solution to treat a common cold without medication would be to rely on herbal remedies. Herbs such as ginger, peppermint, and eucalyptus have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties that can help alleviate cold symptoms. For example, ginger can help reduce inflammation in the nasal passages, while peppermint can help ease congestion and coughs. Eucalyptus oil can also help open up airways and relieve congestion. These herbs can be consumed in various forms, such as tea, capsules, or inhalers.

Saltwater Gargle: Another creative solution would be to use saltwater gargle to help reduce swelling in the throat and loosen mucus. Gargling with warm salt water several times a day can help reduce inflammation and ease a sore throat. Adding a pinch of baking soda to the saltwater can also help neutralize the acid in the throat, providing additional relief.

Humidifiers: A humidifier can help moisten the air and relieve congestion by adding moisture to the nasal passages and throat. This can help reduce coughing and make it easier to breathe. There are various types of humidifiers available, including cool mist humidifiers, warm mist humidifiers, and ultrasonic humidifiers.

Neti Pot: A neti pot is a natural nasal irrigation device that can help flush out mucus and debris from the nasal passages. By rinsing the nasal passages with a saline solution, the neti pot can help reduce congestion and sinus pressure. This can also help reduce the risk of sinus infections and promote overall nasal health.

Aromatherapy: Aromatherapy can also be used to treat a common cold by inhaling essential oils that have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties.
